item.title: Lebanese Parliament Once Again Fails to Elect New President
item.description: Lebanon’s parliament has failed to elect a new president for the 12th time, deepening the country’s political crisis. The failure to elect a president has left Lebanon without a fully empowered government since October 2022, when the previous cabinet resigned. The country has also been facing a severe economic crisis, with a fuel shortage and a looming food crisis.
